英文法規名稱: Enforcement Rules for the Satellite Broadcasting Act
中文法規名稱: 衛星廣播電視法施行細則
沿革內容:
1. 16 Articles promulgated in full by the Government Information Office on June 10, 1999. Ref： (88)-Chien-Guang-(1) Tze No.09241
2. The annulment of Article 3 promulgated by the Government Information office on Oct. 29, 2003. Ref： Hsin-Guang-I No.0920624154
3. Addition of Articles 6-1 through 6-3 promulgated by decree of the Government Information Office in Document Sin Guang I 0930622947A on May 24, 2004

法規內容.條文內容: These Enforcement Rules are established in accordance with Article 45 of the Satellite Broadcasting Act (hereinafter referred to as "the Act").

The format of the application form and operations plan submitted to operate a satellite broadcasting business, as stipulated in Paragraph 1 of Article 6 of the Act, and to apply for a license renewal, as stipulated in Paragraph 2 of Article 6 of the Act, shall be formulated by the regulatory agency. 
Within six months after the application to operate a satellite broadcasting business is approved, and applicant shall use the documents issued by the regulatory agency to apply for the establishment of a business or the change of registration. After a company license is obtained, the applicant shall use the company license to apply for the satellite broadcasting business license.

The minimum paid-in capital for a satellite broadcasting business is as follows:
Direct satellite broadcasting service operator: NT$200 million;
Satellite broadcasting program supplier: NT$50 million; and
Operator of both of the aforementioned businesses: NT$200 million.

In accordance with Article 12 of the Act, to apply for an extension of the operating period, the applicant shall state reasons and submit the following documents:
A photocopy of the satellite broadcasting business license; and
Other documents specified by the regulatory agency.

In accordance with paragraph 1 of Article 13 of the Act, to apply for changes, the applicant shall satate reasons and submit the following documents:
Table of changes and explanation of the amended contents; and
Other documents specified by the regulatory agency.
If the aforementioned documents are incomplete, the regulatory agency shall notify the applicant to supplement incomplete sections within a specified period of time. In the event that the applicant fails to do so within the specified period of time, or, if the supplemented sections are still incomplete, the regulatory agency shall reject the application.

In accordance with Paragraphs 1, 2, and 3 of Article 15 of the Act, if the casse of application for an operating permit falls into the category of Paragraph 2 of Article 6 of the Act, the applicant shall complete and submit an application form with documents in the format specified by the regulatory agency. 
For the branch company or agent of a foreign satellite broadcasting business, the minimum operating capital or the minimum paid-in capital is NT$20 million. For the operator who runs both a branch company and an agent, the minimum operating capital or the minimum paid-in capital is the same. 
When the regulatory agency issues and operating permit for a foreign satellite broadcasting business agent, in accordance with Paragraph 2 of Article 15 of the Act, the permitted operating period shall be equal to the term of the agent, as stated in the agent contract, but shall not exceed a maximum of six years. 
The provisions of Paragraph 2 of Article 2, Article 3 to Article 5, Article 7, and Article 7,and Article 8 are applicable to branch offices or agents of foreign satellite broadcasting businesses.

The agent regulated in Paragraph 2 of Article 15 of the Act refers to the agent acting on behalf of a foreign satellite broadcasting business that engages in program supply operations in the Republic of China. 
In accordance with Paragraph 2 of Article 15 of the Act, the branch office of a foreign satellite broadcasting business, which applies for program supply operations and establishes a branch office or appoints an agent in the ROC, shall make a report and obtain a permit from the regulatory agency. 
In accordance with Paragraph 2 of Article 15 of the Act, the agent acting on behalf of a foreign satellite broadcasting business, which is a provider of two or more channel programs shall make a report and obtain a permit from the regulatory agency.

When a report is filed in accordance with Article 16 of the Act to the regulatory agency for reference, it shall be submitted in writing and accompanied by the following documents: 
Duration of and reasons for suspension or termination of operations; and
Other documents required by the regulatory agency.
The duration of suspension mentioned in Item 1 of the preceding Paragraph shall not exceed six months. 
The notice of Article 16 of the Act shall be made through the exclusive channels or the relevant program broadcasts of a satellite broadcasting business or a foreign satellite broadcasting business, or in written form.

The length of time for advertisementss, as set forth in Paragraph 1 of Article 23 of the Act, does not include the advance notice of the programs on the same channel. 
The display, as set forth in paragraph 2 of Article 23 of the Act, shall be clearly distinguishable and shall be displayed during the entire advertisement.

The rights and obligations of advertisement transmission, as set forth in Item 7 Paragraph 2, Article 28 of the Act, shall include transmisssion time of advertisementss, time slots, or other contents allotted through consultation with cable radio and television system operators (including cable television program transmissiion systems).
The annual report, as set forth in Paragraph 1 of Article 29 of the Act, shall be submitted every April and every October.
The regulatory agency shall make a decision within three months after receiving the documents necessary for the application.

These Enforcement Rules shall take effect from the date of publishing. 　 

Note:
This is a translation from the Chinese text of the law. In case of any discrepancy between the Chinese and English texts, the Chinese text shall govern.
